node.title: 'Privately issued money all too often ends in losses', RBA boss warns on crypto
node.description: Reserve Bank boss Philip Lowe again warns Australians to be cautious of investing in cryptocurrencies, including so-called stablecoins, noting that history shows "privately issued money all too often ends in losses for customers".

node.title: EBOS Group to buy medical equipment distributor in billion dollar deal
node.description: Diversified healthcare, medical and pharmaceutical products distributor EBOS Group has made a deal to buy medical equipment distributor LifeHealthcare for more than a billion dollars.

node.title: BusinessNZ refuses partnership role in Fair Pay Agreements policy
node.description: BusinessNZ has refused to be a formal partner in the government's showcase industrial policy, Fair Pay Agreements.

node.title: Man due in court on firearms-related charges after Ōtara incident.
node.description: A 40-year-old man is to appear in court on firearms charges after an incident in Ōtara.

node.title: Starbucks workers vote on union in upstate New York
node.description: Labor board rejects coffee chain's bid to stop the counting of ballots at three stores seeking to organize.

node.title: Stonewall Jackson, Grand Ole Opry Star for Over 60 Years, Dies at 89
node.description: His biggest record, “Waterloo,” topped the country music chart for five weeks in 1959 and became a crossover hit.

node.title: Greg Tate, Influential Critic of Black Culture, Dies at 64
node.description: His writing for The Village Voice and other publications helped elevate hip-hop and street art to the same planes as jazz and Abstract Expressionism.

node.title: The F.D.A. authorizes AstraZeneca drug to protect people with immune problems.
node.description: The antibody drug, Evusheld, was found to be strongly effective in preventing Covid in a clinical trial that enrolled mostly those at high risk.

node.title: Four Takeaways From the 8th Day of Ghislaine Maxwell’s Trial
node.description: A former pilot and a former assistant at Jeffrey Epstein’s Palm Beach home testified, as prosecutors sought to bolster the accounts of Ms. Maxwell’s accusers.

node.title: Victoria records 1,232 new local COVID-19 cases and nine deaths
node.description: There are now 11,224 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 580 people have died during the state's current outbreak.

node.title: Most business cyber attack victims able to resolve issue
node.description: Most businesses that come under a successful cyber attack are able to resolve the issue before significant damage is done.

node.title: Farmers to vote on Fonterra capital structure changes
node.description: Fonterra farmers face one of the biggest votes in the co-operative's history today.

node.title: Germany's Olaf Scholz takes over from Merkel as chancellor
node.description: Olaf Scholz has been confirmed as German chancellor, leading a three-party government that takes over from Angela Merkel after 16 years in office.

node.title: Tairāwhiti DHB boss appeals for testing, assures support for anyone with Covid-19
node.description: The head of Hauora Tairāwhiti DHB is emphasising those who test positive for Covid-19 will be supported as concerns mount over wastewater samples detecting the virus. Audio

node.title: Man Receives Six Year Sentence After Setting Fire to Nightclub Over Vaccine Passport
node.description: Police said Owen Marshall had become "obsessed" with COVID-19 protocols and was also targeting other venues in the area over the summer.

node.title: Mistrial Declared in Murder Case After Some Jurors Admit Knowing Slain Woman Was Pregnant
node.description: The judge declared a mistrial on the first day of the murder trial after some jurors admitted to knowing the victim was pregnant when they weren't supposed to.

node.title: TikToker Confronts Waiter for Allegedly 'Talking Smack' About Sugar Daddy in Viral Video
node.description: "By the way, that's my sugar daddy, not my uncle or my dad or anything since you guys are so curious over there," the woman said.

node.title: Boy, 12, Killed When Gunmen Fire Dozens of Bullets Into SUV Near School in 'Brazen Assault'
node.description: Los Angeles Police Chief Michel Moore said that the attack seemed "purposeful," but that it was not yet clear what spurred the shooting.

node.title: Dislike for Trump is Why Couple Charged With Espionage Wanted to Leave U.S.: Lawyer
node.description: While prosecutors called Jonathan and Diana Toebbe flight risks, the couple's lawyers said they wanted to leave the country because of Trump's politics.

node.title: House value growth during three months adds $113k to Auckland prices
node.description: In the time since many Aucklanders last had a haircut, the average house in the region increased in value by $113,000.

node.title: Government rejects criticism over Auckland boundary decisions
node.description: Other changes to the Covid-19 plan affected the advice on the Auckland boundary decision, the prime minister and Covid-19 response minister say.

node.title: Whakaari / White Island: Finger pointed back at WorkSafe
node.description: Two years on from the disastrous Whakaari / White Island eruption, a lawyer representing Australian victims says the regulatory shortcomings are "terrifying".

node.title: Government refuses to fast-track ECE rules review
node.description: The government has refused to fast-track a review of core early childhood education rules despite being told they might not be fit for purpose.

node.title: Mark Meadows sues January 6 committee
node.description: Meadows did not appear for a scheduled deposition Wednesday before the House select committee investigating the January 6 assault on the U.S. Capitol.

node.title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
node.description: Pfizer and BioNTech say booster shots offer strong protection against Omicron.

node.title: Supreme Court Seems Wary of Ban on State Aid to Religious Schools
node.description: The case, concerning a tuition program in Maine, seemed likely to extend a winning streak at the court for parents seeking public funds for religious education.

node.title: WHO Warns There's Only 'Anecdotal' Evidence About Omicron, But Strain Could Be Less Severe
node.description: The new COVID-19 variant that had its first confirmed case in southern Africa caused some nations to close their borders and concerned stock markets.

node.title: Video of Lone Waffle House Employee Prepping 12 Orders at Once Sparks Viral Debate
node.description: "Running yourself into a breakdown from exhaustion is not worth your life," wrote one commenter.

node.title: Florida to Test Manatee Feeding Program as Beloved Animals Are Dying at Record Rate
node.description: The program will reportedly feed manatees lettuce, cabbage and other greens in one area to determine its viability to sustain more manatees across the state.

node.title: Pfizer says lab tests show COVID booster may offer protection against Omicron
node.description: Pfizer says lab tests show a third booster shot of its COVID-19 vaccine may offer important protection against the Omicron variant, even though the initial two doses appear significantly less effective.
